summary: The Medicare Orthotics and Prosthetics Patient-Centered Care Act aims to improve access to and quality of orthotic and prosthetic care for Medicare beneficiaries. The bill proposes prohibiting payments for drop shipments of certain orthotics and prosthetics, expanding the definition of practitioners exempt from competitive acquisition, and ensuring beneficiary access to replacement custom-fitted and custom-fabricated orthotics. Furthermore, the Secretary of Health and Human Services is mandated to issue regulations to implement the outlined amendments.
